quoteLast: He found the vakeels, Suleiman and Eddrees, surrounded by many of their men, apparently in consultation.

quoteTime: A little after eight in the evening
quoteLast: the "President" was within a hundred yards of the chase, which could be seen, a dark mass with bright lights shining through the rows of open ports, rushing through the water directly ahead. Rodgers sprang upon the taffrail, and putting a speaking-trumpet to his lips, shouted, "What ship is that?" A dead silence followed.
title: The Naval History of the United States. Volume 1
author: Abbot, Willis J. (Willis John), 1863-1934

quoteFirst: On the 12th of December, after marching five miles through a heavy fall of snow to the village of Tashgang, crossing the river by a wooden bridge close to the village, a violent storm of wind and snow-drift, blowing directly down the valley, compelled me to halt for the night. The snow-storm continued till
quoteLast: , when the weather cleared, and the night was clear and starlight. Next morning, the weather continuing fine, I was able to proceed to Dras.
title:
Western Himalaya and Tibet
A Narrative of a Journey Through the Mountains of Northern India During the Years 1847-8
author: Thomson, Thomas, 1817-1878

quoteFirst: Thus it was we remained all in ignorance of what the enemy might be doing until, at
quoteTime: about eight o'clock in the evening
quoteLast: , our sentinels captured two of the king's men who were out reconnoitering, bringing them into camp.
title:
The Boy Spies with the Regulators
The Story of How the Boys Assisted the Carolina Patriots to Drive the British from That State

quoteFirst: The Father of these boys lived in the town, and they had been home on the Sunday, as was usual, to dine with him. They had just returned from their visit,
quoteTime: about eight o'clock in the evening
quoteLast: , and Charles, the eldest, the fellow who had accused me of being the thief, had now brought these comfits in his hat, saying that his father had given him _five shillings_, which he had expended at once in this way. My friend directly declared that it was a falsehood, that his father was a cursedly stingy old fellow, and that he had never before returned with more than sixpence in his pocket; and he added, suppose his father or any other person had given him _five shillings_, it was very unlikely that he would lay it all out at once in such a manner.
title: Memoirs of Henry Hunt, Esq. — Volume 1
author: Hunt, Henry, 1773-1835

quoteLast: and he informed me of the incident” (he accented the second syllable). “I took no great note of what appeared to be a death from natural causes.
title: The Duke of York's steps

quoteFirst: I think it is time I sent over a few more rifle-grenades—We’ve got a machine that puts them in accurately to a yard and they do a lot of damage. It will stay quiet until
quoteLast: when there will be ‘wind up’ for 2 hours—heavy rifle fire on both sides—then fairly quiet for rest of night unless we drop bombs on them like we did last night. Then Fritz gets in such a funk that he shoots off wildly in _all_ directions except the right one! I must agree with him—it _is_ a nasty thing to be bombarded by an unseen and unlocated enemy in the shape of me or one of my men.
title: 'Trusty and well beloved'
author: Hornung, E. W. (Ernest William), 1866-1921
